Name: Terracotta representing Harpocrates
Description: Figure showing Harpocrates standing, wearing a Phrygian cap. With his right arm he is holding up a torch at the base of which a small lamp with two openings can be distinguished. With the left arm he is supporting the chlamys which falls on his back and shoulders. On the back is a mamelon with a transversal hole for suspension. There is an opening in the base. The piece bears remnants of the preparatory ground in white.
